ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Rapid Estimate of Adult Literacy in Medicine-Short Form (REALM-SF): Total Number of words pronounced correctly
Notes: Number of words pronounced correctly: behavior, exercise, menopause, rectal, antibiotics, anemia, jaundice. Individuals who pronounce 4 or more words correctly are correctly considered to be reading at > 6th grade reading level.

ElementDescription: Rapid Estimate of Adult Literacy in Medicine-Revised (REALM-R) Score
Notes: Number of words pronounced correctly: allergic, jaundice, anemia, fatigue, directed, colitis, constipation, osteoporosis
